subject: RE: [junit] Beginner
msgSnippet: Priyanka, Erich s and my intention is that JUnit is not vast, but rather very approachable for programmers. For books I recommend JB s JUnit Recipes book or,
messageBody:
Priyanka,

Erich's and my intention is that JUnit is not vast, but rather very
approachable for programmers. For books I recommend JB's JUnit Recipes book
or, for a brief (and cheap) introduction my JUnit Pocket Guide, available
from O'Reilly.

Good testing,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of hersheysdairymilk
> Sent: Wednesday, July 13, 2005 10:43 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Beginner
>
> Hi Friends,
> I'm new to this group and also to JUNIT.Can anyone help me
> by advicing URL's for JUNIT and also Books.Is JUNIT too vast
> or simple
> and easy to be learnt ?
>
> Thanks and bye.
>
> Priyanka
